channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Pinoy fishermen eyed as West Philippine Sea militia — defense chief
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: Filipino fishermen are willing to be trained and organized to become the country’s maritime militia to counter China’s massive deployment of paramilitary fishing vessels in the West Philippine Sea, Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana said yesterday.

item.title: DepEd to issue errata for learning modules
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: The Department of Education will address errors found in the self-learning modules it had produced and printed in a rush to roll out distance learning for school year 2020-2021 amid the coronavirus pandemic that prohibited face-to-face classes.

item.title: DOH issues new guidelines on indoor ventilation
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: Pending international and local studies on airborne transmission of COVID-19, the Department of Health has issued new guidelines on proper ventilation in indoor or enclosed spaces.

item.title: DA expects 16% increase in rice production
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: A 16 percent increase in rice production is anticipated in the third quarter of the year, a good indication of employment attraction in agriculture despite the coronavirus pandemic, Agriculture Secretary William Dar said yesterday.

item.title: Palace says pandemic may soon be over
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Malacañang yesterday expressed optimism that the COVID-19 pandemic would end soon after three groups have expressed interest to conduct vaccine clinical trials in the Philippines.

item.title: ‘DTI firm fails to deliver P3.27 billion fire stations, equipment’
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: At least 242 towns have no fire stations or fire trucks, but a Department of Trade and Industry-attached corporation whose task is to import goods has not been able to complete even one of the 98 fire stations it was contracted to build for P892 million, Senate President Pro Tempore Ralph Recto lamented yesterday.

item.title: ‘No agreement on easing travel for long distance partners’
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: Bad news for Filipinos with foreign significant others.

item.title: Privacy commission probes misuse of contact tracing data
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: The National Privacy Commission is conducting a probe on reports that some business establishments are mishandling contact tracing data.

item.title: ‘13th month pay cannot be deferred’
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Malacañang clarified yesterday that the release of the 13th month pay of workers could not be deferred unless the law is amended, after the labor department said that distressed small businesses might be exempted from the requirement.

item.title: ‘Duterte fed up with House intramurals’
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: While a Palace-affiliated media outfit covered Rep. Lord Allan Velasco’s election as Speaker by his allies, President Duterte is not meddling in the leadership war in the House of Representatives and is in fact getting fed up with politicking in the chamber, Malacañang said yesterday.
